solution_line_template: Since a month has four weeks, the tree will increase its height by 2 feet for {num_months}*{weeks_per_month}={total_weeks_growing} weeks after four months of growing.

Since the tree grows at {growth_rate_per_week} feet per week, after {total_weeks_growing} weeks, the tree would have increased its height by {growth_rate_per_week}*{total_weeks_growing}=<<{growth_rate_per_week}*{total_weeks_growing}={height_increase}>>{height_increase} feet.
If the tree is currently {current_height} feet tall, its height after four months will be {current_height}+{height_increase}=<<{current_height}+{height_increase}={final_height}>>{final_height} feet.
